Company: Zhongxing Telecommunications Equipment Corporation and ZTE Kangxun Telecommunications Ltd.
Description: China's Zhongxing Telecommunications Equipment Corporation and ZTE Kangxun Telecommunications Ltd., known collectively as ZTE, agreed to a combined civil and criminal penalty of $1.19 billion after being accused of illegally shipping telecommunications equipment to Iran and North Korea in violation of the Export Administration Regulations and the Iranian Transactions and Sanctions Regulations. As part of the settlement, ZTE agreed to pay a penalty of $661 million to the Bureau of Industry Security, with $300 million suspended during a seven-year probationary period to deter future violations.

Recap of Ownership Changes: Zimmer Holdings and Biomet merged in 2015

Company: Alsima Middle East General Trading LLC
MSI Aircraft Maintenance Services International GmbH & Co.
Alfa Laval Inc. and Alfa Laval Middle East Ltd.
Silicon Space Technology Corporation, d/b/a Vorago Technologies, Inc

Description: Violation of sanctions against Russia. Another $276,382 was credited against $30 million Microsoft was to pay in a related case brought by the Office of Foreign Assets Control.

The Bureau of Industry and Security imposed a $300 million civil penalty against Seagate Technology LLC of Fremont, California and Seagate Singapore International Headquarters Pte. Ltd., of Singapore to resolve alleged violations of U.S. export controls related to selling hard disk drives to Huawei Technologies Co. Ltd. in violation of the foreign direct product (FDP) rule.
failing to report a request to engage in a boycott against Israel

Profense LLC, a manufacturer of defense weapon systems located in Phoenix, agreed to pay a civil penalty of $48,500 in resolution of four violations of the antiboycott provisions of the Export Administration Regulations.
B.E. Meyers, a defense contractor, agreed to pay a civil penalty of $44,750 in resolution of three violations of the antiboycott provisions of the Export Administration Regulations.

The Bureau of Industry and Security imposed a civil penalty of $48,750 against Pratt & Whitney Component Solutions to resolve 13 violations of the antiboycott provisions of the Export Administration Regulations relating to Israeli goods. PWCS voluntarily disclosed the conduct to BIS, cooperated with the investigation by BIS's Office of Antiboycott Compliance, and took remedial measures after discovering the conduct at issue, all of which resulted in a significant reduction in penalty.

The Bureau of Industry and Security announced the imposition of a civil penalty of $44,750 against Forta LLC, a manufacturer of synthetic reinforcement fibers, located in Grove City, Pennsylvania, to resolve three violations of the antiboycott provisions of the Export Administration Regulations (EAR, 15 C.F.R. parts 730-774).
